00033 Robot::Robot(string name,double length,double width,double narrowDist,Point center):
00034 robotLength(length),
00035 robotWidth(width),
00036 narrowestPathDist(narrowDist),
00037 robotName(name),
00038 robotCenter(center)
00039 {
00040         this->setCheckPoints(narrowDist);
00041 }
00042 
00046 void Robot::setCheckPoints(double obst_r)
00047 {
00054         safetyTolerance = 0.05;
00055         if(narrowestPathDist < 2*robotWidth)
00056         {
00057                 expansionRadius = (narrowestPathDist - safetyTolerance)/2.0f;
00058         }
00059         else
00060                 expansionRadius = robotWidth/2.0f - safetyTolerance;
00061         cout<<"\n Obstacle Expansion Radius="<<expansionRadius;
00062         int point_index=0,points_per_height,points_per_width,n;
00063         double i,j, l = robotLength , w = robotWidth;
00064         check_points.clear();
00065         // The edges of the robot in -ve quadrant
00066         Point temp,edges[4];
00067         edges[0].setX(-l/2);            edges[0].setY(w/2);
00068         edges[1].setX(l/2);                     edges[1].setY(w/2);
00069         edges[2].setX(l/2);                     edges[2].setY(-w/2);
00070         edges[3].setX(-l/2);            edges[3].setY(-w/2);
00071         Pose pose(-robotCenter.x(),-robotCenter.y(),0);
00072 //      cout <<"\nCenter Point X:"<<center.x()<<" Y:"<<center.y();
00073         // am determining here the location of the edges in the robot coordinate system
00074         startx = -l/2 - robotCenter.x();
00075         starty = -w/2 - robotCenter.y();
00076         // These Points are used for drawing the Robot rectangle
00077         for(int s=0;s<4;s++)
00078         {
00079                 local_edge_points.push_back(Trans2Global(edges[s],pose));
00080         }
00081         for (int s=0 ;s < 4; s++)
00082                 cout<<"\nEdge->"<< s<<" X="<<local_edge_points[s].x()<<" Y="<<local_edge_points[s].y();
00083         // Create a Matrix of the points to check for collision detection
00084 
00085         points_per_height = 2;//(int)(ceil(l/(double)(2*expansionRadius)));
00086         points_per_width  = (int)(ceil(w/(double)(2*expansionRadius)));
00087         n = points_per_height*points_per_width;
00088         cout<<"\nPer H ="<<points_per_height<<" Per W="<<points_per_width<<" Total ="<<n;
00089         cout<<"\nObstacle Radius="<<expansionRadius; fflush(stdout);
00090 
00091         // The location of the current edges at each NODE
00092         i = startx + sqrt(expansionRadius*expansionRadius - pow(w/2.0f,2) - safetyTolerance);
00093         for(int r =0; r < points_per_height ; r++ )
00094         {
00095                 j=(starty + expansionRadius);
00096                 for (int s=0;s < points_per_width;s++)
00097                 {
00098                         // Angle zero is when robot heading points to the right (right had rule)
00099                         temp.setX(i);
00100                         temp.setY(j);
00101                         check_points.push_back(temp);
00102                         point_index++;
00103                         //cout<<"\n I="<<i<<" J="<<j;
00104                         /* Determining the next center it should be 2*r away from the previous
00105                          * and it's circle should not exceed the boundaries
00106                          */
00107                         if ( (j+2*expansionRadius + expansionRadius) >= (w + starty) )
00108                                 j = (w + starty - expansionRadius);// Allow overlap
00109                         else
00110                                 j += (2*expansionRadius);
00111                 }
00112                 // Same as Above
00113                 if ((i+2*expansionRadius + expansionRadius) >= (l + startx))
00114                 {
00115                         // Alow overlap in this case, this is the last center
00116                         i = (l + startx - expansionRadius);
00117                         i = l + startx - sqrt(expansionRadius*expansionRadius - pow(w/2.0f,2) - safetyTolerance);
00118                 }
00119                 else
00120                         i += (2*expansionRadius);
00121         }
00122         for (unsigned int k=0;k<check_points.size();k++)
00123         {
00124                 check_points[k].setY(0);
00125                 cout << "\nPoint to check "<<k<<"'---> X="<<check_points[k].x()<<" Y="<<check_points[k].y();
00126                 fflush(stdout);
00127         }
00128 };
00130 double Robot::getExpansionRadius()
00131 {
00132         return this->expansionRadius;
00133 }

00137 };
